SEARCH
Package executor.service.security

Class RsaManager

java.lang.Object
executor.service.security.RsaManager
@Component public class RsaManager extends Object
Manages RSA key pair for encryption and decryption operations.

The RsaManager class is responsible for managing the RSA public and private keys. It is annotated with Component to indicate that it is a Spring-managed bean and can be injected into other components.

This class utilizes the PublicKey and PrivateKey interfaces to represent the RSA key pair. The key pair is initialized using values retrieved from the application's configuration properties specified by the public.key and private.key properties.

The publicKey and privateKey fields hold the actual instances of the PublicKey and PrivateKey interfaces, respectively. The corresponding key values are stored as strings in the publicKeyString and privateKeyString fields, which are annotated with Value to be populated from the application's properties.

It is crucial to configure the correct key values in the application's properties to ensure proper initialization of the RSA key pair. Additionally, care should be taken to secure the private key since it is used for decryption operations.

  • Method Details

    • initFromStrings

      @PostConstruct public void initFromStrings()
      Initializes RSA public and private keys from string representations.

      This method is annotated with PostConstruct, indicating that it should be called after the bean has been constructed and the properties have been set. It is responsible for decoding the string representations of the RSA public and private keys and initializing the corresponding PublicKey and PrivateKey fields.

      The publicKeyString and privateKeyString fields hold the Base64-encoded string representations of the RSA public and private keys, respectively. These strings are decoded using the decode(String) method, and the resulting byte arrays are used to create instances of X509EncodedKeySpec and PKCS8EncodedKeySpec for the public and private keys, respectively.

      The KeyFactory is then used to generate the actual PublicKey and PrivateKey instances from the key specifications. In case of any errors during the initialization process, a RsaManagerInitializationException is thrown.

      Throws:
      RsaManagerInitializationException - If an error occurs during RSA manager initialization.
      See Also:
      • PostConstruct
      • PublicKey
      • PrivateKey
      • X509EncodedKeySpec
      • PKCS8EncodedKeySpec
      • KeyFactory
      • RsaManagerInitializationException

    • encrypt

      public String encrypt(String message)
      Encrypts a message using RSA encryption algorithm.

      This method encrypts the specified message using the RSA encryption algorithm with Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP) scheme, SHA-256 as the hash function, and MGF1 as the mask generation function.

      The message is first converted to bytes using the getBytes() method. Then, a Cipher instance is initialized with the RSA public key for encryption. The encryption is performed in ECB (Electronic Codebook) mode, and OAEP padding with SHA-256 and MGF1 is used.

      If the encryption is successful, the encrypted bytes are encoded into a Base64 string using the encode(byte[]) method, and the result is returned. In case of any errors during the encryption process, the error message is returned as a string.

      Parameters:
      message - The message to be encrypted.
      Returns:
      The Base64-encoded string representation of the encrypted message, or an error message.
      See Also:
      • Cipher
      • PublicKey
      • NoSuchAlgorithmException
      • NoSuchPaddingException
      • InvalidKeyException
      • IllegalBlockSizeException
      • BadPaddingException

    • decrypt

      public String decrypt(String encryptedMessage)
      Decrypts an encrypted message using RSA decryption algorithm.

      This method decrypts the specified Base64-encoded encrypted message using the RSA decryption algorithm with Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP) scheme, SHA-256 as the hash function, and MGF1 as the mask generation function.

      The Base64-encoded encrypted message is first decoded into a byte array using the decode(String) method. Then, a Cipher instance is initialized with the RSA private key for decryption. The decryption is performed in ECB (Electronic Codebook) mode, and OAEP padding with SHA-256 and MGF1 is used.

      If the decryption is successful, the decrypted byte array is converted to a string using UTF-8 encoding, and the result is returned. In case of any errors during the decryption process, the error message is returned as a string.

      Parameters:
      encryptedMessage - The Base64-encoded encrypted message to be decrypted.
      Returns:
      The decrypted message as a string, or an error message.
      See Also:
      • Cipher
      • PrivateKey
      • NoSuchAlgorithmException
      • NoSuchPaddingException
      • InvalidKeyException
      • IllegalBlockSizeException
      • BadPaddingException
